net.netnook.repeg

Interface Context


  • public interface Context
    Context used by OnSuccessHandler to process matched input.

    When an OnSuccessHandler for an expression is called, that expression is considered the 'current' expression. When called, the Context contains both the input position before the expression was evaluated (i.e. the start position) as well as the input position after the expression (and all of it's sub-expressions) was evaluated. The full input text which was matched by the current expression (including all sub-expressions) can be retrieved using the getCurrentText() method.

    An OnSuccessHandler may be used in expressions to process the current input and add or modify a stack used to build up the output of the parser. To this end, the Context also contains the starting position/size of the stack before the expression (or any of it's sub-expressions) were evaluated. An OnSuccessHandler can simply add an element to the stack (e.g. convert the current input sequence from getCurrentText() to an Integer and push it onto the stack) or retrieve elements from the stack which were added by sub-expressions using get(index), process them in some way, and then replace them with some computed value using replace(object).

    Important: A Context object may be re-used across calls to multiple OnSuccessHandlers. You should therefore not keep a reference for use later but instead do all processing immediately in the OnSuccessHandler recipient.
